meanings.definition: The act of moving to a new place or position.
meanings.sent1: The relocations of the family to a bigger house brought them joy.
meanings.sent2: The company's relocations to a new office building were smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The relocations of the penguins to a warmer climate made them waddle happily.
meanings.sent4: The relocations of the books to the new library shelves created a colorful display.
meanings.sent5: The relocations of the ants to a different anthill fascinated the children.

meanings.definition: The process of moving employees or equipment to a new location.
meanings.sent1: The relocations of the workers to the new factory were completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The relocations of the machinery to the warehouse required careful planning.
meanings.sent3: The relocations of the office chairs to the meeting room seemed like a game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent4: The relocations of the tools to the toolbox were like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The relocations of the vehicles to the parking lot were done systematically.
